It’s been more than 4 months since @HouseDemocrats sent @SenateGOP $3.4 trillion in desperately-needed coronavirus relief & McConnell hit the brakes.   Republicans must meet us halfway & pass the updated #HeroesAct to protect lives livelihoods & the life of our democracy.

How many lives could have been saved if Trump had actually been honest about the danger posed by the coronavirus? It’s time for the Republican Senate to do the right thing put #FamiliesFirst and pass the #HeroesAct. https://t.co/BzlBQlFrOr

I’m encouraged by the "K-12 Bridge to Broadband" initiative connecting students to virtual learning from their homes during the COVID-19 pandemic. Partnerships like these help make sure that ALL students have the resources they need to be successful. #ConnectedEd https://t.co/2h9OC5jj4Q

Instead putting #FamiliesFirst the President has devoted himself to dismissing facts and ignoring the best advice of experts. More than 6 million Americans have tested positive for COVID-19. Republicans must meet Democrats halfway and come back to the negotiating table. https://t.co/NJlL7VzU5M

It's been 101 days since the House passed the #HeroesAct to fight COVID-19. How many days must American families and frontline heroes go without desperately-needed support before Republicans in Congress are ready and willing to act?

Today I was proud to vote to pass two critically needed bills H.R. 7027 the Child Care is Essential Act and H.R. 7327 the Child Care for Economic Recovery Act to address the child care crisis in North Carolina and across the country by providing relief through COVID-19. https://t.co/ROsCCbmVls

COVID-19 has devastated the child care sector forcing closures and exacerbating the shortage of quality affordable care. That’s why @HouseDemocrats are advancing two bills to provide relief for families and providers and support the safe reopening of our economy. #SaveChildCare https://t.co/d4YukwDB9l
